title: What is the difference between sessions and cookies?
post_text: Cookies are client-side files on a local computer that hold user information and end on the lifetime set by the user. Sessions are are server-side files that contain user data; and when the user quits the browser or logs out of the programmed, the session is over..

title: How does JavaScript know when a function is asynchronous?
post_text: An async function is a function declared with the async keyword, and the await keyword is permitted within it. The async and await keywords enable asynchronous, promise-based behavior to be written in a cleaner style, avoiding the need to explicitly configure promise chains. Async functions may also be defined as expressions.
